  • Jeremiah 52
1 ... saying: If a woman put away her husband, and he go from her, and become another woman's, may she return unto him again? Will not that land be greatly polluted? But thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; and wouldest thou yet return to Me? saith the Domina. 2 Lift up thine eyes unto the high hills, and see: where hast thou not been lain with? By the ways hast thou sat for them, as an Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy harlotries and with thy wickedness. 3 Therefore the showers have been withheld, and there hath been no latter rain; yet thou hadst a harlot's forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed. 4 Didst thou not just now cry unto Me: 'My mother, Thou art the friend of my youth. 5 Will She bear grudge for ever? Will She keep it to the end?' Behold, thou hast spoken, but hast done evil things, and hast had thy way.

 6 And the Domina said unto me in the days of Josiah the queen: 'Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel did? he went up upon every high mountain and under every leafy tree, and there played the harlot. 7 And I said: After he hath done all these things, he will return unto me; but he returned not. And him treacherous brother Judah saw it. 8 And I saw, when, forasmuch as backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put him away and given him a bill of divorcement, that yet treacherous Judah him brother feared not; but he also went and played the harlot; 9 and it came to pass through the lightness of him harlotry, that the land was polluted, and he committed adultery with stones and with stocks; 10 and yet for all this him treacherous brother Judah hath not returned unto Me with him whole heart, but feignedly, saith the LORD--   11 even the Domina said unto me--backsliding Israel hath proved himself more righteous than treacherous Judah. 12 Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say: return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the Domina; I will not frown upon you; for I am merciful, saith the Domina, I will not bear grudge for ever.
13 Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the Domina thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every leafy tree, and ye have not hearkened to My voice, saith the Domina. 14 Return, O backsliding children, saith the Domina; for I am a domina unto you, and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion; 15 and I will give you shepherds according to My heart, who shall feed you with knowledge and understanding. 16 And it shall come to pass, when ye are multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the Domina, they shall say no more: The ark of the covenant of the Domina; neither shall it come to mind; neither shall they make mention of it; neither shall they miss it; neither shall it be made any more. 17 At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the Domina; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the Domina, to Jerusalem; neither shall they walk any more after the stubbornness of their evil heart.   18 In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your mothers.' 19 But I said: 'How would I put thee among the daughters, and give thee a pleasant land, the goodliest heritage of the nations!' And I said: 'Thou shalt call Me, My mother; and shalt not turn away from following Me.' 20 Surely as a husband treacherously departeth from him wife, so have ye dealt treacherously with Me, O house of Israel, saith the Domina. 21 Hark! upon the high hills is heard the suppliant weeping of the children of Israel; for that they have perverted their way, they have forgotten the Domina their God. 22 Return, ye backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings.--'Here we are, we are come unto Thee; for Thou art the Domina our God. 23 Truly vain have proved the hills, the uproar on the mountains; truly in the Domina our God is the salvation of Israel. 24 But the shameful thing hath devoured the labour of our mothers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their daughters and their sons.
